intro: Drynaria longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed tree fern, is a species native to Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rhizome is thick and woody, supporting the tall stem, while the fronds are pinnately compound and can reach lengths of up to several meters. Drynaria longipes is valued for its ornamental appearance and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
